text: I mention this in your hearing, Jane, that you must allow: and now return to your own room; think over all I have said, in the closest manner! #JaneEyre

passages.fragment: I mention this in your hearing , Jane , that you
passages.full_quote: <used>I mention this in your hearing, Jane, that you</used> may not attempt to impose on Mr

passages.fragment: , Jane , that you must allow : and now return to
passages.full_quote: "But you are passionate, <used>Jane, that you must allow: and now return to</used> the nursery -- there's a dear -- and lie down a little."

passages.fragment: and now return to your own room
passages.full_quote: "I will account for this state of affairs" ( pointing to the bed ): "<used>and now return to your own room</used>"

passages.fragment: to your own room ; think over all I have said ,
passages.full_quote: Go up <used>to your own room; think over all I have said, a</used>nd, Jane, cast a glance on my sufferings -- think of me.

We were, as <used>I have said, in the</used> dining-room: the lustre, which had been lit for dinner, filled the room with a festal breadth of light; the large fire was all red and clear; the purple curtains hung rich and ample before the lofty window and loftier arch; everything was still,

"too, like _you_, whose very countenance may vouch for your being amiable" -- but she contented herself with, "and one, too, who had probably been his companion from childhood, connected together, as I think you <used>said, in the closest manner</used>!"
